intro: Psychotria fluviatilis, commonly known as the river psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as riverbanks and forest understories. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in humid, lowland areas with high rainfall.
